abstract: Africans seeking asylum in Israel are being released in compliance with Supreme Court order reducing holding time to 1 year; Israel Prison Service reports 1,178 of 1,750 migrants released from Holot detention center in Negev region.
lead_paragraph: The move complied with a recent Supreme Court ruling that reduced the time that migrants could be held at the center.

headline.main: Israel Begins Releasing African Migrants From Detention Center
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Israel: Court Ruling Prompts Mass Release of Migrants

snippet: The move complied with a recent Supreme Court ruling that reduced the time that migrants could be held at the center.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
